posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
I'll take a closer look at this later (kinda rushed atm)... but the DM/DS in a build that is not CHA-focused is just about worthless. You'll sneeze and those buffs will be over. Also, Blind Fight is essential for all meleers against concealment. Once you free up the prereq of PA for the divine feats, you may find more use out of Knockdown/IKD than Cleave. Without actually working it out, I'd leave CHA at 15, maybe 16 if necessary (your DCs and will be pedestrian anyway without focus) and max STR for AB/damage boosts and Discipline. Lingering Song will make leveling MUCH easier if you can fit it in (pretty standard fare for a singer) and I'd love to bump up both Imp Crit into Pre-epic and WS/EWS to Level 21 (would be ftr 18 thru 21 perhaps) again for faster leveling. The use of BG if only for divine feats probably weakens the overall potential IMO.

Like I said, these are just first impressions without working it out... basically an impromptu wish list. See if that makes sense or helps at all. I'll leave the Arelith-specific considerations for last to expedite the analysis.

Lata with better help I hope.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Nokteronoth wrote:I'mm replug everything through the Pretty Good Character Creator and see what happens. Although for level 20, I'm taking a fifth CoT level instead of Fighter. Then It'll have Divine Wrath. (Neither gets a bonus feat on that level, so I figured it'd be the same with either except that CoT gets Divine Wrath and a fun toy to play with for a round. To be showy.)
~Nok
I think you are gradually picking up on the value of all of these 1x/day feats. "Showy" is a valid description. Mainly they are intended as finishing actions to dispatch a tough opponent or boss once they have been injured enough to exact a killing stroke. However, basing a build on those feats (Cleric's War/Battle Mastery is another one of those, probably superior to Divine Might or Divine Wrath, but requires many cleric levels to make it as effective), just weakens the build's potential.

In the case of Divine Might, you need to vest into a class with prereq feats that you may never even use. In PvP, Power Attack and Cleave are totally worthless. PA because you won't hit anything with it but low AC toons and Cleave because you'd need to fight Pv2P to get any use at all out of it at all. Also, with a pedestrian STR level resulting from splitting abilities to enhance CHA, your AB and damage will suffer dramatically. I.e. you won't get a chance to exhibit that "showy" divine damage because your toon won't be able to hit anything substantial. Unfortunately, there are no "permanent" effect feats that add the CHA modifier to the attack roll or you'd see a whole new slew of builds posted.

CoT's prereqs are more lenient (higher BAB but only WF feat), assists somewhat in providing some better feat availability, has some feat synergy with fighter class and helps to avoid the XP problems. But Divine Wrath also needs a HUGE CHA commitment to become "showy".

Committing to a singer build is not a bad idea. Songs are irresistible and with the Song/Curse combo will double both AB and AC boosts for your singer, a consequence of the reciprocal effect on enemies. In dead or chaotic magic zones, Bards are sweet! But singing is essentially just buffing, so a solid attack and defense build is necessary to end up with a competitive warrior.

A few more comments, a few which I have repeated many, many times before (ECB vets, please take this opportunity to move the damp clothes into the dryer )...

PvP is always a custom build. By "custom", I mean vs. a specific class combo. There are no universal PvP builds. When you optimize to deal with say a Weapon Master, you'll fall prey easily to clerics and mages. The reverse is true. Building to withstand caster foes, means your melee prowess will suffer and fighters will own you. Not to mention those blasted Arcane Archers.

Those builds that advertise it as PvE or PvM/PvP require the basic build to be significantly redesigned for each type of PvP encounter and the original design can be unrecognizable.

So, the bottom line is: decide on EXACTLY what you seek to achieve and describe in detail your preferences. Refrain from requests like "a character that will cause huge damage against all kinds of opposition". There ain't no such animal and never will be without selecting that custom feat that assures your toon will roll nothing but 20's.

Play style can make or break any build plan. At times, a builder will actually go step-by-step through how they use the build in practice. Should another user of the build stray too far from the optimum style, results may be poor. So it is best to build-test-tweak-test-tweak-test, rinsing and repeating as necessary. Usually, after a few alterations and retests it should become apparent where the weaknesses are and if it is within the scope of the build's framework to succeed as desired. For every build that I have created and tested to my own satisfaction there are probably a dozen or more on the cutting room floor. So don't be afraid to discard any "guesses". It's part of the creativity cycle, amigo!

posts.author: DragonatorXII
posts.content:
I've done a similar build on arelith, and it actually turned out great. I went 20 Bard/Fighter 6/ Blackguard 4. I also used Divine Might, and shield. It did pretty amazing in PvM & PvP, with a buffed AC of 72 and AB of 39. Switchable to 62 AC & 49 AB, or 67 AC & 42 AB. I started with 16 Strength, 15 Charisma, 10 Con, and 14 INT. I took the strength, constitution, and charisma gifts. Giving me 18 Strength, 17 Charisma, 12 Constitution, and 14 Intelligence starting.

Hip. you mentioned that DM/DS would be worthless. They ended with 18 Charisma. That can easily be picked up to 30 on arelith, giving it a duration of 10 rounds, an extra 10 damage, and +10 AC for 10 rounds. Which, is pretty useful in PvP on arelith. Especially when wielding a scimitar or rapier, that's an extra 20 damage on many hits, which can break the line of winning or losing.

You also mentioned still spell. On arelith, which this build is designed for (As noted by getting gifts, I can only assume!), there is armor that you can craft that has spell failure lower on it. So, still spell is a waste of a feat. But, for other PWs that don't have the option of still spell.. Yeah, good choice! I have to agree with power attack being worthless on the original build posted by Nok. Though, if that AB was boosted somehow, I can see power attack being useful against many melee characters. (From my experience, many melees on arelith have low AC. Generally the barbarian WMs and fighter-wms.)


The CoT/Bard/Fighter looks pretty solid. Though, I honestly think lingering song is a waste of a feat. It can make leveling easier, but you get lasting inspiration end build. That's my personal opinion though, since I always build for end build.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
The term "worthless" was a relative one, probably inappropriate. Apologies. The efficiency depends on the server and types of battles. It's simple arithmetic. After 1 turn, you'll need to "waste" 2 rounds with a 2 turn attempts to resurrect the divine effects again. Multiply that by the number of "feat resurrections" per battle and you are exposing yourself to what I feel are unnecessary "free attack rounds" for the enemy (IIRC TU attempts cannot cause an AoO). But maybe your dice roll better than mine. I usually get KD'd or disarmed when rebuffing in combat, or worse, DevCritted. I've found it better to keep the pressure on and force the foe into a non-combat action grab a free attack round and perhaps an AoO besides. Some (or all) of the amount of the damage added by DM can be offset by the foe's counter during those lost rounds.

The commitment to equip CHA boosters to provide better utility of the divine effects instead of +STR ones (again, w/o knowledge of item enhancements on Arelith) to overcome AC with the increased AB (unconditionally) and add phys. damage (again, unconditionally, except for DR considerations) albeit not of the divine type that DM provides... that whole decision has a cost. The Power Attack feat is necessary to meet the BG Cleave prereq (unless it is different on Arelith), so essentially 2 feats thrown away for BG if PvP is the ultimate goal (clerics can also elect DM/DS if really desired and w/o class prereqs). PA & Cleave... useful for dispatching mobs of kobolds, I suppose, or bashing chests... are PvM-only feats.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Nokteronoth wrote:30: Fighter(7): Epic Prowess
Fighter 7 gives you nothing here. WM 8 will not add anything either.
Bard 17 will give you access to more known spells, give you more spell slots and open up for lvl 6 spells. Bard will also let you increase class skills to 33 ranks

Bard song and Curse song lvl 16 need 30 perform. With cha 16 you only need 27 ranks. If you plan on buffing with eagle's splendor, you can get away with 25 or 26 ranks

I also think Curse song comes too late. I would have taken it earlier, perhaps swapped place with IKD
